Description: Round-topped limestone stela of Amenemhat; nineteen rows of Hieroglyphic text.
Curator's comments: Published: HTBM 4: Plate 48-49 PM I Part 2: p.808
Bibliographic references: Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (pl.48-49)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Royal United Service Institution (United Service Museum)
Acquisition notes: Lot 196 in July 1861 Sotheby's auction where described as “Lot 196. A large sepulchral stone tablet. With 19 lines of well-executed and well preserved hieroglyphics, including birds, figures etc. Height 39 ins. Width 38 ins.”
